wikipedia_page.main: Air Marshal Sir Geoffrey Howard Dhenin,  (2 April 1918 – 6 May 2011) was a British physician and senior Royal Air Force officer. From 1974 to 1978, he served as Director General of the RAF Medical Services.

response: * Geoffrey Dhenin (1918–2008); awarded the AFC twice for his role in the British nuclear weapons tests in Australia (1954 and 1959).
*Geoffrey Dhenin, physician and senior Royal Air Force officer
* 2 April – Geoffrey Dhenin, Welsh air marshal and physician (died 2011)
**Sir Geoffrey Dhenin, air marshal and physician (b. 1918)
